channel.title: Brother can't log in. (SOLVED DELETE PLEASE)
channel.description: Alright so i have a server, it's online people are always online, but when my brother tries to log in (on the same ip as me) it won't let him connect. i think that this is because we are on the same ip so my question is how do i fix this?

oh alright dude thanks for the help, i need help with one more thing it that’s not to much to ask

item.title: Brother can't log in. (SOLVED DELETE PLEASE)
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

No, that’s your actual ip address.

Open command prompt, type in ‘ipconfig’ and look for ‘IPv4’

item.title: Brother can't log in. (SOLVED DELETE PLEASE)
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

^ No. Your client would be localhost.

His would be your IPv4 address.

item.title: Brother can't log in. (SOLVED DELETE PLEASE)
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

all of the posts above are wrong, but no offense for trying. +1

when you portforward, everyone outside of your connection (wireless/lan) will either use a dynamic address, or your actual ip-address.

everyone on the same network as you will connect to the IPv4 address.

you, however, will use ‘localhost’, 127.0.0.1, or whatever your default gateway is.

Read full topic
